steps.title: Open a file that you want to make into a GIF in Paint.
steps.content: Open a file that you want to make into a GIF in Paint. You can do this by navigating to your file in File Explorer, right-clicking it, then selecting Open With > Paint . Or you can launch Paint, then go to Menu > Open > and Select your file. If you don't have an image already that you'd like to turn into a GIF, you can open MS Paint from the Start menu and create a new image now. You can open images in JPG, BMP, TIFF, and PNG formats. steps.title: Edit the image.
steps.content: Edit the image. Use the tools like "Selection," "Image," and "Brushes" to add elements to the picture. If, for example, you selected a picture for a background , you can insert words or draw on it. Make sure you utilize all the tools appropriate for your images, like shapes, text, brushes, or stickers.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's in the toolbar near the top left.

steps.title: Click Save as and GIF Picture.
steps.content: Click Save as and GIF Picture . You'll see Save as in the panel on the left side of the page and GIF Picture will be an option in the menu that expands out.

steps.title: It is not possible to make an animated GIF in Microsoft Paint.
steps.content: It is not possible to make an animated GIF in Microsoft Paint. Animated GIFs contain multiple frames, which Paint cannot do. Instead, you can make individual images in Paint using the method above and then go to a free site like https://ezgif.com/maker to add all your still images together and create an animated GIF! Since you can only make simple GIFs with Paint, you'll want to use a website or program like Photoshop, Carpstudio, GIPHY or GIMP . Those other programs will help you create GIFs with moving frames.
